intro: Crescentia donnell-smithii, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is a member of the Bombacaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces large, woody fruits that split open to reveal seeds covered in a fleshy, sticky coating. Crescentia donnell-smithii typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Its unique morphology and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
